title: I'm being sued by Nelson&Kennard for Main Street Acquisition Corp. Form of stipulation In lieu of judgement, is not agreeable
question: I had an account for a credit card with HSBC bank Nevada NA. The account went to collections with Stoneleigh Recovery Association LLC, and there was no resolution (numerous calls and hang-ups).
question_tags: LLC (limited liability company),Business contracts,Bankruptcy,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Filing a lawsuit
answers:
Did you, by your attorney, file an Answer to the lawsuit? Is the "court date" a trial, a status conference, or some other proceeding? Have you (through your attorney) propounded discovery upon the plaintiff?

If the case goes to trial, the plaintiff will need to present competent evidence at trial regarding the opening of the account, the terms of the contract, the history of the account, the chain of assignment, etc. If your attorney is formally representing you in this litigation, you should follow the advice of your attorney.

The answer depends upon whether or not Stoneleigh acquired the debt.

1. If yes, you will probably have to pay them, but the amount can be negotiated even after judgment.

2. If no, then you will still have to deal with HSBC, but Stoneleigh is their agent/representative.

If you are already being represented by an attorney, it wouldn't be proper for any of us on this forum to advise you. Your attorney has the best and most complete information about your case, whereas we only have a one paragraph synopsis.

You need to hire a collections lawyer. I have handled cases against Nelson and Kennard, and if you serve a notice to attend trial (requiring their witness to attend trial and serve discovery), they will move off their position.

Did you answer the complaint? Hire a good debt collection attorney.
